```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(readr)
dat <- read_csv("~/GitHub/hw2-afierro/CleanPittArressts.csv")
```

```{r}
table(dat$Arrest1)

#Relabel Sex by making a new variable because I don't know how else to do it
dat$"Sex2" <- NA
dat$"Sex2" [dat$Sex == "F"] <- "Female"
dat$"Sex2" [dat$Sex == "M"] <- "Male"

#Relabel Race by making a new variable because I don't know how else to do it
dat$"Race2" <- NA
dat$"Race2" [dat$Race == "A"] <- "Asian"
dat$"Race2" [dat$Race == "B"] <- "Black"
dat$"Race2" [dat$Race == "H"] <- "Hispanic"
dat$"Race2" [dat$Race == "W"] <- "White"

#subset out NA's for Sex2
dat.sex <- subset(dat, !is.na(dat$Sex2))
#subset out NA's for Race2
dat.race <- subset(dat, !is.na(dat$Race2))

ggplot(data = dat, aes(x = Arrest1 )) + geom_bar()

ggplot(data = dat.sex, aes(x = Sex2)) + geom_bar()

ggplot(data = dat.race, aes(x = Race2, fill = Arrest1)) + geom_bar()

```
